options.content:
# Metric Integrations Overview

IBM Cloud Pak for AIOps is capable of ingesting metrics from a variety of sources.
This dashboard will provide insight into the health & performance of the following integrations: AWS CloudWatch, AppDynamics, Instana, New Relic, Splunk, Zabbix

Only integrations that have been created in the IBM Cloud Pak for AIOps Integrations page will have metrics visible here.

panels.description: Count that tracks the number of pods that were newly created within the time range.

0.text: pods are stable - review uptime graph for gaps

1.text: 1 new pod within time range - review uptime graph for gaps

2.text: 2 new pod within time range - review uptime graph for gaps

3.text: 3 new pod within time range - review uptime graph for gaps

4.text: 4 new pod within time range - review uptime graph for gaps

5.text: 5 new pods within time range - review uptime graph for gaps

6.text: 6 new pods within time range - review uptime graph for gaps

7.text: 7 new pods within time range - review uptime graph for gaps

8.text: 8 new pods within time range - review uptime graph for gaps

9.text: 9 new pod within time range - review uptime graph for gaps

result.text: 10-20 new pods within time range - review uptime graph for gaps
21-40 new pods within time range - review uptime graph for gaps
21-40 new pods within time range - review uptime graph for gaps

defaults.noValue: pods are stable - no new pods within time range

panels.description: This panel displays the number of active pods for all defined Metric integration pods. Pods stuck in "Pending" or "Unknown" states for prolonged periods of time are problematic and may result in loss of functionality.
panels.title: Metric Integration Component Pods

panels.description: Pod uptimes for metric integrations.
panels.title: Metric Integration Component Pods Uptime

panels.description:
Count of pods that have exceeded 80% of their CPU limits within the time range. This will result in CPU throttling and potentially temporary loss of functionality

This will only compare against the ***current*** CPU limit of each pod. If the limits were updated within the time range, the count may be inaccurate.

0.text: pod-level CPU usage is stable - all usage has stayed under 80% of current limits

1.text: 1 pod has exceeded 80% of their CPU limits - review CPU graphs for spikes

2.text: 2 pods have exceeded 80% of their CPU limits - review CPU graphs for spikes

3.text: 3 pods have exceeded 80% of their CPU limits - review CPU graphs for spikes

4.text: 4 pods have exceeded 80% of their CPU limits - review CPU graphs for spikes

result.text: 5+ pods have exceeded 80% of their CPU limits - review CPU graphs for spikes

targets.expr: sum((((max(kube_pod_container_resource_limits{pod=~"nrelic-conn-.*|ibm-grpc-instana-connector-.*|appd-conn-.*|ibm-awscw-conn-.*|splunk-conn-.*|ibm-zabbix-conn-.*", container!="", container!="POD", resource="cpu"}) by (pod)) * 0.8 <= max(max_over_time(node_namespace_pod_container:container_cpu_usage_seconds_total:sum_irate{pod=~"nrelic-conn-.*|ibm-grpc-instana-connector-.*|appd-conn-.*|ibm-awscw-conn-.*|splunk-conn-.*|ibm-zabbix-conn-.*", container!="", container!="POD"}[$__range])) by (pod)) or vector(0)) > bool 0)

panels.description:
Count of component pods that have exceeded their memory limits within the time range.

This will only compare against the ***current*** memory limit of each pod. If the limits were updated within the time range, the count may be inaccurate.

0.text: all pod-level memory usage has stayed under current limits

1.text: 1 pod has exceeded their memory limits - review memory graphs for spikes

2.text: 2 pods have exceeded their memory limits - review memory graphs for spikes

3.text: 3 pods have exceeded their memory limits - review memory graphs for spikes

4.text: 4 pods have exceeded their memory limits - review memory graphs for spikes

result.text: 5+ pods have exceeded their memory limits - review memory graphs for spikes

targets.expr: sum((((max(kube_pod_container_resource_limits{pod=~"nrelic-conn-.*|ibm-grpc-instana-connector-.*|appd-conn-.*|ibm-awscw-conn-.*|splunk-conn-.*|ibm-zabbix-conn-.*", container!="", container!="POD", resource="memory"}) by (pod)) <= max(max_over_time(container_memory_working_set_bytes{pod=~"nrelic-conn-.*|ibm-grpc-instana-connector-.*|appd-conn-.*|ibm-awscw-conn-.*|splunk-conn-.*|ibm-zabbix-conn-.*", container!="", container!="POD"}[$__range])) by (pod)) or vector(0)) > bool 0)

Count of pods that have exceeded their CPU limits within the time range. This will result in CPU throttling and potentially temporary loss of functionality.

0.text: all pod-level CPU usage has stayed under current limits

1.text: 1 pod has exceeded their CPU limits - review CPU graphs for spikes

2.text: 2 pods have exceeded their CPU limits - review CPU graphs for spikes

3.text: 3 pods have exceeded their CPU limits - review CPU graphs for spikes

4.text: 4 pods have exceeded their CPU limits - review CPU graphs for spikes

result.text: 5+ pods have exceeded their CPU limits - review CPU graphs for spikes

targets.expr: sum((((max(kube_pod_container_resource_limits{pod=~"nrelic-conn-.*|ibm-grpc-instana-connector-.*|appd-conn-.*|ibm-awscw-conn-.*|splunk-conn-.*|ibm-zabbix-conn-.*", container!="", container!="POD", resource="memory"}) by (pod)) * 0.8 <= max(max_over_time(container_memory_working_set_bytes{pod=~"nrelic-conn-.*|ibm-grpc-instana-connector-.*|appd-conn-.*|ibm-awscw-conn-.*|splunk-conn-.*|ibm-zabbix-conn-.*", container!="", container!="POD"}[$__range])) by (pod)) or vector(0)) > bool 0)

panels.description: This panel displays the CPU usage over time of the integration pod(s). Spikes can occur during data collection, monitor these to ensure the integration is not ingesting more than it can process. Create more integrations as needed to ensure stable collection and timely processing.
panels.title: AWS CloudWatch Integration CPU Usage

panels.description: This panel displays the memory usage over time of the integration pod(s). Spikes can occur during data collection, monitor these to ensure the integration is not ingesting more than it can process. Create more integrations as needed to ensure stable collection and timely processing.

panels.description: Total number of metric messages collected within the time range across all metric integrations. Metric messages are made up of 1-x actual metrics pertaining to a particular resource. Check the "Total Metrics Collected" for the total number of actual metrics.

defaults.noValue: No metric messages collected within time range

targets.expr:
sum(increase(ibm_aiops_metricconnector_cloudwatch_live_metrics_data_size_objects_sum[$__range]) or vector(0)) +
sum(increase(ibm_aiops_metricconnector_cloudwatch_historical_metrics_data_size_objects_sum[$__range]) or vector(0)) +
sum(increase(ibm_aiops_metricconnector_appdynamics_live_metrics_data_size_objects_sum[$__range]) or vector(0)) +
sum(increase(ibm_aiops_metricconnector_appdynamics_historical_metrics_data_size_objects_sum[$__range]) or vector(0)) +
sum(increase(ibm_aiops_metricconnector_instana_metrics_data_size_objects_sum[$__range]) or vector(0)) +
sum(increase(ibm_aiops_metricconnector_splunk_live_metrics_data_size_objects_sum[$__range]) or vector(0)) +
sum(increase(ibm_aiops_metricconnector_splunk_historical_metrics_data_size_objects_sum[$__range]) or vector(0)) +
sum(increase(ibm_aiops_metricconnector_newrelic_live_metrics_data_size_objects_sum[$__range]) or vector(0)) +
sum(increase(ibm_aiops_metricconnector_newrelic_historical_metrics_data_size_objects_sum[$__range]) or vector(0)) +
sum(increase(ibm_aiops_metricconnector_zabbix_live_metrics_data_size_objects_sum[$__range]) or vector(0)) +
sum(increase(ibm_aiops_metricconnector_zabbix_historical_metrics_data_size_objects_sum[$__range]) or vector(0))

panels.title: Metric messages collected

panels.description: Total number of metric messages collected by each integration within the time range. Metric messages are made up of 1-x actual metrics pertaining to a particular resource.

defaults.noValue: No metric messages collected within time range

panels.title: Metric messages collected per integration

panels.description: Total number of metric messages collected within the time range across all metric integrations. This contains the total number of individual metrics contained within all the metric messages.
panels.title: Total Metrics Collected

panels.description: Per-second rates of metric messages collected by each integration. Metric messages are made up of 1-x actual metrics pertaining to a particular resource.

defaults.noValue: No metric messages collected within time range

panels.title: Metric message collection rate

panels.description: Number of collections conducted within the time range.
panels.title: Metric collections

panels.description: Number of collections that resulted in an error within the time range. Errors will end the current collection, but will not impact future collections from happening. The subsequent collection after an error will proceed as scheduled.
panels.title: Errors

panels.description: Number of collections that were interrupted within the time range. Interruptions are more severe than errors and will prevent any further collections. Review the component pods for error logs.
panels.title: Interruptions

panels.description: Total number of metric messages collected within the time range per integration.
panels.title: Metric messages collected per integration

panels.description: Per-second rates of metric messages collected by each integration.
panels.title: Metric message collection rate
